description:
The contrast ratio to reach against white, to determine if color changes from "light" to "dark".
Acceptable values for WCAG 2.0 are 3, 4.5 and 7.
Default dark color for WCAG 2.0.
Default light color for WCAG 2.0.

parameter.description: The color to calculate the relative luminance for.

description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors

usedBy.description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

description: Checks if a color is dark

return.description: True if the color is dark, false otherwise

description: Checks if a color is light

return.description: True if the color is light, false otherwise

description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

parameter.name: dark
parameter.description: The dark color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: light
parameter.description: The light color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: min-ratio
parameter.description: The minimum contrast ratio to reach

return.description: The color with the highest contrast ratio

description: Color palettes to be used in the Kendo UI themes.

description: Returns whether `$list` is bracketed.
Joins two lists together.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.description: The separator to use between `$list1` and `$list2`.

parameter.name: bracketed
parameter.description: Whether the result should be bracketed.

example.code:
@debug k-list-join( ( "foo", "bar" ), ( "baz", "qux" ) ); // => "foo, bar, baz, qux"
@debug k-list-join( ( "foo", "bar" ), ( "baz", "qux" ), " " ); // => "foo bar baz qux"

description:
Restricts `$number` to the range between `$min` and `$max`. If `$number` is
less than `$min`, `$min` is returned. If `$number` is greater than `$max`,
`$max` is returned. Otherwise, `$number` is returned.
